review_blob:
A wonderfully hoppy and delicious beer. Fremont brewing company definitely knows how to use those "C" hops. The version of this beer that I had utilized Simcoe and Citra.... Nuff said, an amazing treat.

Also had this one at the washington brewers festival randalled through some basil and other herbs. It was summertime in a glass!
beer_name: Fremont Cowiche Canyon - Citra & Simcoe (Fresh Hop)

review_blob: I had this beer on tap at the washington brewers festival. It truly exemplifies everything that an american IPA should be. Anyone can brew a bitter IPA, its not challenging at all... This beer is loaded with juicy citrus hop flavor and aroma that will punch you in the face. This was a very clean finishing beer that did not linger in your mouth long.

Aroma-  smells terrible for an ipa. Definitely an aroma present, but smells atypical of northwest ipas.... More like a damp, mildew filled basement or something.
Appearance- looks nice, not black... Dark brown with a tan rocky head.
Taste- offensive to my palate. Maybe this was infected or something. Phenolic, plasticy... These terrible off flavors cover up anything that may be good underneath.
Palate- lacking in body and way over carbonated. Slightly astringent.
Overall- I can hardly believe that this is a commercial beer. When I saw the score of 90, I was floored. This beer is a drain pour. The only reason why I drank half of it was for these tasting notes. I seriously want my 4.50 for the bomber back. Awful!

12oz bottle I had while visiting friends in Chicago- This is beer packs the most citrusy, passionfruity hop aroma/flavor that has ever graced my mouth. I was completely blown away by this one, a truly world-class brew!

Aroma- citrusy delicious amarillo hops all the way.
Appearance- somewhat transparent dark brown. may be a bit light for a CDA/Black IPA.
Taste-delicous fruity taste from late hop additions. malty sweetness and some roast characters
Palate- medium to light bodied with a slightly bitter finish.

This is one of my favorite winter seasonals from the pacNW. Not as bitter as many of the other black ipa/Cdas out there. The wonderful amarillo hop aroma is what truly does it for me. well crafted

poured hazy and golden from the bottle. nice frothy head. aroma was sweet and spicy. tasted sweet and yeasty with some notes of coriander and fruits. not too heavily carbonated and had a decnt aftertaste. I thoroughly enjoyed this beer and would purchase it in the future

poured black from the bottle with a quickly diminshing head. Aroma was of chocolate and dark malts. tasted great! rich flavor, coffee, chocolate, alcohol. Definitlely a slow drinking beer, had a nice warming effect to it.
beer_name: North Coast Old Rasputin Russian Imperial Stout

review_blob: poured from a 12oz can. dark brown, almost black with a light tan head. aroma was awesome dark malts, coconut. Taste was chocolate, coffee, malty, and of course the toasted coconut. medium body with average carbonation and nice aftertaste. I tried pretty much all of the beers of Hawaii during my trip, this was definitely the best one

poured from the bottle into its corresponding glass. It has a wonderfully toasted malty aroma. It has a dark brown body that you can see light through. Taste is absolutely amazing; roasted malts, raisin, clove, sweet Belgian sugars... wonderful. Medium body to the palate, average carbonation with a delightful alcohol burn as it finishes. This beer was just great.
Poured into a lager glass from the bottle. Light yellow with dissipating head. Tastes of corn and cereals, like a typical cheap beer. I dont think this is really a pilsner

This is the perfect beer if your goal is to get hammered drunk in the Philippines for pennies on the dollar. You can get a bucket of six of these beers at the bars for about 4 dollars. I drank it straight from the clear bottle, it was light yellow and tasted of cheap cereal grains almost unnoticeable hop presence.

Bottle. Pours orange-blonde with sticky white head. Aroma is of sweet fruits and yeast. Taste is amazing lots of flavor here... banana, clove, sweet fruits. Very smooth drinking brew and the alcohol is masked very well. This is one of my favorite Belgians

Bottle. Poured into the kwak specialty glass with wooden stand. Golden-amber color with a long lasting head. Rich aroma and flavors of raisin, clove, and slight floral hops. Average carbonation and slightly bitter aftertaste. pretty decent Belgian

Bottle. Pours dark brown with creamy beige head. Aroma is of roasted malt sweetness, earthy. Taste is of raisin, sugars, alcohol. Lively carbonation with slightly bitter aftertaste. Definitely not my favorite Belgian but is drinkable. I think it may be slightly over-rated

Bottle. Pours tanslucent orange-gold with clumpy white head. Aroma is of Belgian yeast, alcohol, sweet malts. Tastes of slight banana, slight clove but overwhelmed by alcohol taste. Very strong, fizzy carbonation mouthfeel. I think this may have been an older bottle

The only thing this beer really has going for it is the aroma. After one takes a sip, they will quickly realize that it tastes like artificial pumpkin flavoring. This is my least favorite pumpkin beer
Aroma is somewhat lacking and skunky. Appearance is golden, clear with fizzy white head.  Light, bitter taste with an unpleasant aftertaste.
great citrusy hop aroma and taste with a strong malt backbone to support it. A staple IPA, one of my favorites.
